Title: Directs the public service commission study the feasibility and the costs of burying all or most of the electrical, telephone and internet transmission lines in New York state
Summary: Directs the public service commission to study the feasibility and the costs of burying all or most of the electrical, telephone and internet transmission lines in New York state and to publish and deliver a report of its findings to the governor and the legislature, and requires new electrical, telephone and internet transmission lines to be buried underground.
ActClause: AN ACT to amend the public service law, in relation to directing the public service commission study the feasibility and the costs of burying all or most of the electrical, telephone and internet transmission lines in New York state and to publish and deliver a report of its findings to the governor and the legislature, and requiring new electrical, telephone and internet transmission lines to be buried underground
